title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University
Interview Descriptions: his information guide will help break down the parts of an interview, types of interviews, interview do’s and don’ts, basic interview questions, and also offer a few suggestions for questions you may want to ask an employer. Remember that practice makes perfect. You can create and practice your responses to common interview questions and register for mock interviews through Career Services.
Interview Questions: ob interviews are often perceived as an unpleasant rite of passage. However, with ample preparation, it is possible to enter the interview process with confidence and to enjoy the experience. A common misconception of those new to the process is that the interviewer holds all the power. Instead, the interview is a way for both parties to assess the fit between you and your skills and interests, and the company and its values and culture.

title: Robotics Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions:
The process took 3 months 
The first one from the recruiter, then next I had a initial semi technical interview with a senior mechanical engineer. They allocated 1 hr for the interview but it lasted for only 20 minutes. It felt like the person clearly not interested in talking to anyone but they forced him to do it. Instead of the interviewer asking questions, I was the one who was asking more questions and kept the conversation alive for some time.

Then no word from them for 2 months and then again got call for the next round which was a paired interview. They literally told me due to their seniors on vacation they were on hold. 
The interview was 1:30 minutes where they asked a ton of hypothetical questions from robotics background system, including navigation, path planning and more. Initially I think I was doing good but at some point it felt like they don’t seemed to care my answers and started behaving rude. 
One thing they should understand is that, if someone is highly experienced in robotics field he or she will not going to go for CMU NREC job with low pay.
Interview Questions: Robotics navigation, path planning, control and more hypothetical question.

title: Machine Learning Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions:
I interviewed at NREC as a ML Engineer. Several zoom interviews later was called for an onsite interview. Didn't get a reimbursement for the travel expenses (see update). This whole process took 5 months. Interviewers were absolutely condescending. I wanted to leave half way into the process. I guess this is what happens when you have a bunch of old incompetent geezers and insecure people. I personally felt like they were looking for more of a cultural fit than your qualifications.

The first interviewer was nice, showed me around campus (which is in an abandoned pipe factory). This guy wants to leave badly. You can see it by his attitude. He told me in the first interview how he had to beg the director for several years to let him take classes at CMU while working there. He also interviewed at least one company while employed at NREC.

The second interviewers were also nice.

In the third round of interviews I literally had one lady (senior engineering manager) who was frowning the whole time, and another guy (robotics engineer) who constantly felt the need to assert his dominance (usually a sign of insecurity). The lady started off by bragging about how she was a nuclear engineer and such, and was condescending throughout the entire process. It felt like she already had someone else in mind and was trying to promote that person by playing political games. She spent the majority of the time down valuing my experience and qualifications. Since these are paired interviews, if one person gives off a negative impression that automatically imprints on the other. This is how broken their process is. Then again, should not be unexpected given the delusional nature of the director (keep reading).

Keep in mind that this is during interviews where people are supposed to be on their best behavior. I would hate to imaging what they are like outside of interview setting. Actually, now that I think about it, I did have one guy - a former interviewer - come into lunch and sit secluded from the rest of the team. If you ask me, I'd say that he hates the rest of the team. Can't imagine why.

Overall most of the people came across as closed and narrow minded. I should also mention that these people first conducted a reference check before even deciding to interview me in-person. This is extremely disrespectful and a waste of time for my references who are researchers and principal software engineers. Reference burnout is a thing. My advice to the people interviewing at this place would be to get first a written offer contingent on reference and background checks, and then give these people the reference list.

Interview with the director started off with saying how they can't afford 80k for someone who would be doing the job of software engineering, data engineering and ML engineering. To top it off he said that they don't like people who leave for better opportunities while the entire time dangling the carrot of getting to take classes at CMU. Not sure if the guy is delusional or too far detached from reality or both.

After the interview I withdrew all of my applications for this place. The recruiter still sent me an email telling me that I had not been selected to move forward.

What a joke of an organization. This place likes to dangle the carrot of getting to take classes at CMU while paying you significantly less than market value - 120,000 national average for ML engineers. The director did this to me several times. I guess this is the only way they can get candidates to apply and take the offer.

Update: Several emails exchanges later I got the reimbursement after 2 months.

Update: I recently accepted a position at a semicondictor industry as a Machine Learning Engineer with a base salary of $180000 (I asked for 130-140K), $10000 sign on bonus, and $25000 RSU with a vesting period of 1 year
Interview Questions:
Reverse the string
Several ML questions - what is bias and variance, what is the difference between classification and regression, What is the effect on the output feature maps of the convolution layer that follows a max pooling layer. Why do we want a maxpooling layer. When to use a confusion matrix. What is the difference between precision, recall and F1. what is focal loss, what is dice loss.

ML System Design (Facial recognition system) - think about clustering, dimensionality reduction, database storage, approximate nearest neighbor search, reducing database lookup time with horizontal scaling. Also think about feature/concept drift detection and rectification. Talk briefly about knowledge distillation, model quantization and pruning.

Data engineering question - how would you remove duplicate images? Hash the images using a fingerprinting algorithm using DFT. Similar to how shazam's audio fingerprinting works. Now you have reduced the problem to removing duplicate fingerprints. If you type "image hashing" in google, a lot of academic papers with noise robust algorithms will pop up.

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions:
Such a backwards, slow process. The left hand doesn't know what the right hand was doing. I had my first phone interview with the recruiter about 2 weeks after applying. Another 2 weeks later, I had another phone interview with the department heads. Another 2 weeks after, I had an in-person interview and a meet-and-greet with HR and the department. Over this time I was called their "shining star," "best choice out of x-number of applicants." Even behind the scenes, they were exclaiming how excited they were to have me on board.
Fast forward, two months later: 99% of my follow-up emails and voicemails were ignored. They decide to tell me they have chosen another applicant. Horrendous process, completely wasted my time.
Interview Questions: "What do you expect to be the hardest part of this job?"

title: Robotics Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very good. Took 3 weeks. They asked questions about perception, motion planning, general software engineering and vision related topics. People are open and friendly and they have lots of good projects going on there
Interview Questions: How do you reverse a linked list?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Directly meet with the research director to talk about the specific research topic you want to do during your work time. Also, introduce your own background to see whether it has a fit. Then meet with other colleagues in this team.
Interview Questions: What is the topic in this field you want to study?

title: Front End Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very difficult interview process, 4 interviews total, 1 over the phone, 1  1:1, 1 with business operations and manager and last with engineering manager. Very satisfied after working there for a while now.
Interview Questions: Develop a front end simple page that integrates with the Google Maps API and is responsive - 1 hour.

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Quick in-person interview just as a screening, very informal. They just want to get to know who you are as a person and whether you'd be a good fit for the company. They also just ask about your schedule to see whether you can offer the number of hours they need you to work.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: Extra In Video Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview face to face. There was just an exchanging of emails which resulted in me getting an offer to be an extra in the Tepper Quad opening video which took place the next following days.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Associate Bursar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview that was very rushed and unprofessional, the interviewer spoke more and did not provided enough time to properly answer the questions.  At the end the interviewer asked if there were any questions and stated you have 2 minutes left to have them answered.
Interview Questions: How you motivate staff?

title: Tech Support Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pitts, PA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: talk with the manager, ask some easy questions about hardware troubleshooting, the manager was very nice, and after the interview, we started to schedule my time slots to work. She also showed me around the office and acquainted me with other coworkers.
Interview Questions: just some basic questions about hardware troubleshooting experience

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen, video, and in - person interview. Everyone was very friendly and made me feel comfortable and welcomed. In-person interview was long but the conversations were good. Overall a good experience.
Interview Questions: Mostly behavioral questions.

title: Technical Writer/Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with the immediate manager and the team. The process took a half day. It was either 8-12 or 1-4. They did give you a break for water. You may need to take a test.
Interview Questions: Why would you want to work here

title: Student Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Interview was quick and easy, more of a formality than anything. They just give you a  quick call on the phone to ask about your resume and applicable experience. After a chat they accept most applicants because there is a very high turnover rate for student callers.
Interview Questions: Have you ever worked in alumni relations before?

title: Front End Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Tough interview process - 4 interviews in total, 1 phone-call, 3 on site. 1st conversational, background oriented, 2nd  background, personality on-site, 3rd technical, creative, 4th meet the department's director, leader.
Interview Questions: You have 1 hour, use javascript or jquery to populate forms from static data on an html page, give it a design oriented responsive look.

title: Research Proposal Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had one phone interview with HR that lasted about 45 minutes, one video conferencing interview with a panel of people that lasted an hour and a half, and an onsite interview with a panel of people that lasted half the day.
Interview Questions: Why should I hire you? What contacts do you have in industry? What would you do in the first 90 days if you are hired

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Sat down with HR to go over goals and what type of work I was looking for, followed by interview with heads of different departments who needed employees. Met with a manager in the mail room and one in the contracts department.
Interview Questions: Q: What kind of work are you interested in?

title: Graduate T Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Apply to Professor
Check how well you know the course.
How do you communicate with students.
How you solve their problems without giving away the solution
Command over English and technical subject is a must
Mostly you need to have taken the class earlier before you can TA the course, unless it is a undergrad level course
Interview Questions:
Check how well you know the course.
How do you communicate with students.
How you solve their problems without giving away the solution
Command over English and technical subject is a must
Mostly you need to have taken the class earlier before you can TA the course, unless it is a undergrad level course

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Just had to apply online through their portal. I was simply called with an offer. There wasn't really an interview process because it was a Research Experience for Undergraduates which is just an apply-and-accept thing.
Interview Questions: There was not an interview question. There was really only a project placement screening, but they had two potential projects for me that our conversation aimed to make a choice from.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University
Interview Descriptions: I first Applied online. I had a Phone interview 1 week later. Then i was  invited in for a panel interview with 5 different current employees. process took about 2 weeks overall. A very normal experience in general
Interview Questions: where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Mscf Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was on skype. Basic questions about resume and career plans. Easy process. Just prepare for every experience on the resume and be ready to answer questions about them. R
Interview Questions: Walk me through your resume

title: Cmu TA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Actually this job comes along with my admission of a graduate program at Carnegie Mellon University. I apply online from the CMU official online application website. The application took about 2 months for me to get the result of admission
Interview Questions: SOP

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I have the interview two weeks ago. The man asked me about my project experience and some CS fundamental knowledge. Then give me the coding question. Not too hard. I didn't received offer from them. This is a small company.
Interview Questions: add two linkedlist into one linkedlist.

title: Computing Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Mostly behavioural interview not too many technical questions since they have a good idea based on the classes I have taken. focused more on the dynamics of working within a team and how I would deal with certain situations i.e. uncooperative team member etc. Also asked about prior experience in working with code/ projects done in class etc.
Interview Questions: How would you handle an urgent ticket at work

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted a week after applying. The HR worker emailed me first to set up a phone interview. After the the phone interview I was informed that I would be contacted again if the recruiting manager wanted to move forward after reviewing the phone interview results.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for CMU?

title: Innovation Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very fast and quick, they got back to me very quickly. Two people were there to interview, asked mostly behavioral questions. There were no technical questions asked.
Interview Questions: Strengths and Weaknesses

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had applied for another position at the university, which was filled internally. I got an email from HR asking for a phone interview later that week. A week later, I received an email asking me to pick a time for in-person. The process lasted four hours and required me to meet with groups of people at different times. It was very different and much longer than any interview I've ever had, but I enjoyed it enough to accept the offer a week later.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: TA Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Conversation with the other teaching staff and the professor, within the university and the specific department looking at how to push the subject matter for the course, It was very friendly and simple process
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position? and this subject

title: Pre-College Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was straightforward. Applied online, everyone undergoes a group interview that tests your team ability and an individual behavioral interview that gauges your interest about the position and what you would bring to the program.
Interview Questions: What activity/club would you start as a counselor for the students?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University
Interview Descriptions: Recommended by my former adviser, so I directly contacted my current adviser, sent her my CV, and we had a couple of conference calls. We talked about the projects I did in my graduate school, the projects in her lab, working environment and style of her lab, funding possibilities, and so on.
Interview Questions: what's your dissertation about?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Interview process for a graduate student is pretty standard. By the time you go for an interview, you are already accepted into the program so meeting them is just knowing everyone better, learning the culture and for helping you to decide if you want to go with this school/program.
Interview Questions: About your resume, undergraduate experience, future interest, skills and expertise. It was pretty general. Just be prepared to tell about your undergraduate research experience.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The professor had interviewed me on Skype. He talked about the projects he is currently working on. It was my first interview with a professor, and he made me very comfortable during the meeting.
Interview Questions: Which areas of my (professor) expertise did you want to work on?

title: Marketing Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very smooth, but a little daunting.  Met with VP first then had three follow-up interviews that day with teams of three to five people each.   All in the same afternoon.
Interview Questions: Questions were pretty standard.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Interview lasted for 1 hour. I was quizzed about the subject. Evaluated past performances and my ability to interact with students. The professors have been doing this for a very long time so they ultimately know what they expect in a teaching assistant and so I was asked questions about my knowledge on specific issues which are newly introduced to the curriculum and was gauged on how well I handled topics I am not aware of. I was made aware of the qualms of the work, like workload, responding to a student in doubt and the technical issues with grading and updating the lists on the university blackboard portal.
Interview Questions:
Past experience with the subject
Presentation skills
Interpersonal skills

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: The first step of the interview was a phone screening. The interviewer asked mostly about my current research activities and then explained the project they wanted me to work on. After the phone screening, they invited me for onsite interview. During onsite interview, I met with the supervisor first. We discussed mostly about different research projects. Finally, I gave a presentation on my research.
Interview Questions: Discuss about your dissertation?

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions:
The hiring process for undergraduate TA's varies on the course you are applying to teach for. Some courses conduct formal interviews, with a series of questions that targets both subject knowledge and interpersonal skills and decision making.

Sometimes, a casual conversation with the professor is all that is required. But regardless, you are expected to have excellent performance in the class, or in an equivalent one.
Interview Questions: What do you want to gain from being a Teaching Assistant?

title: Andrew Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: You will be asked to attend a brief (usually 20 minute) interview with the student coordinators, although sometimes you will also meet with one of the admission counselors. They focus more on questions that would be related to the tour than office work.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite and least favorite thing about Carnegie Mellon?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very standard for a technician position: I was asked for my background in research, my career goals, and my research interests. I was then given an overview of the lab's current research directions, during which I was expected to ask questions to fill in my gaps in understanding. Overall, a very positive experience.
Interview Questions: What are your career goals after the completion of your project here?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Told Professor about my interest to be a teaching assistant. Since I had the top grades and the best project from last year, he agreed. I followed up with our department co-ordinator and also told her personally about this alongside going through the formal procedure.
Interview Questions:
1) Why are you interested in this course?
2) What do you hope to achieve through a teaching assitantship?
3) Do you have any suggestions on how to improve the course from last year?

title: Research Designer and Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had a screening interview with a recruiter in HR, then a phone interview with the Director that was hiring for the position, and then an in-person campus interview.  The in-person interview had an interview with the director of the office, a presentation to guests invited from other offices on campus, and a lunch with other staff members in the office.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Talk to one of the PhD students who you get assigned to and tell them about your skills and interests. They care about your interest and want to pick a project that will benefit you. You get a lot of flexibility since there are lots of things that are yet to be implemented
Interview Questions: What computer vision technologies are you familiar with

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University
Interview Descriptions: Took 2 months for HR to even call for phone interview. Then another month to have an in person interview with hiring manager (however this is very common in academia). Very laid back, a few prepared questions but nothing awkward. HR met with me directly after to discuss benefits and salary expectations.
Interview Questions: How would I manage a difficult peer?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: We were invited to submit our resumes to the graduate program advisor.Then resumes were shortlisted and I was selected for interview.The interview was more about cloud computing and the various databases I was familiar with.I was asked about the NoSQL Database Hbase.The interview was after a month from the resume short listing process.
Interview Questions: Lowest ancestor of a binary search tree.

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was an undergrad teaching assistant for CMU Department of Mathematical Sciences. Usually, the application's deadline is around the mid-semester break for each semester. If interested, you need to contact the TA supervisor - Dr. Deborah Brandon and she will send you a simple form to fill in. After submitting the form, you will be scheduled for an interview with Dr. Brandon and she will let you know whether the department will hire you right after the interview.
Interview Questions: Have you had any teaching experience before?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Submission of CV, followed by online interview, followed by in-person multiple interviews by stakeholders in a few different departments. In-person interviews were scheduled over two days @ CMU and were followed by a required presentation to faculty and students. It was one of the most grueling two days I've had, though it was also quite enjoyable. CMU has a talented faculty and forward-thinking curricula.
Interview Questions: Many questions from how I saw the discipline's evolution through how we might interface with various communities of practice.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburg, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I initially contacted the professor directly and applied online. After several rounds of emails, the professor asked two of his senior Ph.D. to give me a 30 minutes interview. A week later, I am notified to be accepted.
Interview Questions: Since I work on NoC, most of questions are really targeted to test your knowledge on this area.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, then followed with phone interview. They asked reference letters and then do on-site interview. The on-site interview includes a seminar in research group, individual meeting with professors and lab tour.
Interview Questions: Research experience, expertise, etc.

title: Master In Computer Vision Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: It's a 15 min Skype interview about my research background. The interviewer is a professor of the newly-founded department. He probably read my CV beforehand, so he didn't spend time on introduction stuff. Instead he asked about some project details directly. I think I did not so well but I got the admission offer. I didn't go there because I got another offer from where the tuition is much cheaper.
Interview Questions: Explain your undergraduate research projects.

title: Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University
Interview Descriptions: Contact professors whose project you're interested in and would like to research for. Fill out application and make sure to follow through. Sometimes professors or graduate students are not keen on follow ups.
Interview Questions: Mostly typical; behavioral questions and what you want to gain out of the research.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. I found the job posting online, sent email to the ISR regarding the position, matched with two projects. I talked with 2 supervisors from ISR separately via skype. Both offered the jobs and I chose the one I was more interested.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths regarding this job position?

title: Community Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Resume, Cover Letter, Application with questions related to vision and purpose of the CA role
45-minute interview with panel of 3-4 Housefellows consisting of a 15-minute presentation based on your House vision and three of the First-Year/Upperclass guiding principles, followed by 30 minutes of questions and discussion related to your background and vision
Interview Questions: Talk about a time when you persuaded or influenced a group.

title: ResearchDatabase Group Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty basic. Most of the questions were about what I did before. I was also explained my roles and the system that was being built. I was asked some questions on database systems as my work would require knowledge on database systems, specifically the internals. I did not have much experience dealing with database internals, but I was selected anyway. They already had 4 people with previous experience with database internals, hence they were ready to give me a chance even without extensive prior knowledge.
Interview Questions: Have you worked with database internals before? If yes, in what context?

title: Unix Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University
Interview Descriptions: Multiple initial communications. They are very selective and discriminating on whom to hire. It took forever to get started. Place was just busy. Relocation included and some time allowed to adjust to work; incredibly smart people to work with. Work is very demanding and they are always struggling to be on the forefront of research and technology.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Software Engineering Inst Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University
Interview Descriptions: Three phone interviews and several hour interview in person.  I had to do a half hour presentation, do a question and answer session.  Submitted all online information and everything for a background check.. was strung along for months.
Interview Questions: very difficult, on the spot interview

title: Desk Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: The hiring manager calls you into his office or does a phone call.  10 minutes tops.  They are more willing to hire people if you apply during the summer so that you can start working for orientation week when all the new freshman come to Carnegie Mellon Campus.  They want to make sure you have a friendly demeanor and a responsible person.  It is also a customer service and secretary position because sometimes visitors or parents will ask you questions about the university and you have to keep each dorm building's supplies in check and make sure everything is in order.
Interview Questions: How many dorms are there on campus?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: meet professors to discuss research interests, skills for the projects they are working on, how these skills can fit into those projects, meet post-docs and existing phd students, choose a potential list of professors to work with
Interview Questions: relating prior work with current projects, skills used in prior projects, willingness to learn and apply new skills and do interdisciplinary work

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: The course professor asked some fundamental questions. Since i had taken the course previously, it was easy to get the job. It involved asking the number of hours that i can put in since i was taking other courses, and a few questions from previous years.
Interview Questions: How many hours a week can you put in this TA apart from your studies?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process really depends on the department. For mechanical engineering, you need to submit online application, well, just like all other jobs, then if a professor is interested in you, he/she will call/email you, if you are in US, you will get an invitation for campus visit, then if the professor still likes you, they will make you an offer
Interview Questions: Just the regular stuff, whether or not you know some field in their research and whether you are interested in becoming part of the group, etc.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University
Interview Descriptions: Fairly simple interview, you have to have done well in the class, pretty casual, make sure you know what hours you are available and that you can attend class lectures, show that you are hard-working and that you enjoy the class
Interview Questions: I don't remember there being a difficult question

title: Assistant Professor - Visiting Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University
Interview Descriptions: The visiting position was advertised in June for a position to begin in August, so they were rather disorganized. The panel who interviewed me was representative of the department, it was done by phone due to the tight timeframe. I was told there would be a full time tenure track search, that I was asked to write the description for and then didn't get it.
Interview Questions: The questions were fine in the phone interview; in the tenure track interview, one of the senior tenured faculty asked what I meant by historiography.

title: Sei Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed by second round in person interviews. After the final round it was difficult to get ahold of HR to determine when a hiring decision was made.  Everyone was very nice throughout the process but the lack of follow-up even to inform they had chosen another candidate was disappointing
Interview Questions: General situational questions: name a time you didn't meet a goal, deadline, failed etc

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University
Interview Descriptions: Submit application online, and wait for the professor to contact you in person. When the professor decide you are a fit to the project, then go into his office to have an 1-1 interview, and  if he finds your skillset is a match to the position, then you would be qualified.
Interview Questions: What is your overall understanding of data analysis

title: Desk Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: It's very easy. They just make sure you will do the job, and you aren't a delinquent I guess. It's more of a small chat than an actual interview. I would still say dress well, because over the summer it isn't competitive, but during the year everyone wants this job since it's the easiest, and it pays just as much as other jobs
Interview Questions: If you find a desk attendant has been arriving tardy to his/her shifts, how would you react?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview i talked to a professor via skype, He asked me about the process and the progress of my own research. He really likes my research interest and my mathemtical training
Interview Questions: Research interest

title: MS-SE Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University
Interview Descriptions: Interview process on Sype. And a code exercise was given on a choice of your language.
Interview Questions: What are your plans. And what do you want to do after completing your education

title: School of Computer Science - Employment Process Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is very lengthy; I met with 6 people on two different days after having a phone interview.  I met with 2 people for an hour and then two other people for an hour.  Was called back and met with 2 other people for an additional 2 + hours.  Everyone was extremely professional, but the one interviewer typed on the computer the entire interview (typing the answers to my interview questions) which distracted me and I don’t know why, but I could not maintain focus as I am used to face to face conversations during a job interview.  Although I appreciate the idea of saving paper, the interviewers face was in the computer the whole time and I thought that defeated the purpose of having a face to face.  Not meant to be perceived as negative, but for me, I just didn't care for it as I prefer engagement. Overall, it was a pleasant place to interview.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions; nothing out of the ordinary.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University
Interview Descriptions: The application process is department dependent. After being accepted, I was invited to attend an open house, which I did attend. The open house included presentations about the department and the different research project that would likely be available. Time was allotted for one-on-one meetings with faculty that matched our interests.
Interview Questions: The application essay contained the only questions that were posed.

title: Senior Information Security Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University
Interview Descriptions: Rigorous vetting process, with about 8 hours of interviews and multiple panels/one-on-one interviews.  Numerous unwinnable scenarios and edge questions about different technologies.  The interview would be pretty hard to fake, and I was able to prove competency in relevant fields.  Sometimes the questions were a little "out there," however the interview process was exactly what I would expect from a top tier school.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pitts, PA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: The process is quite standard for graduate school. Apply online via a form, and they will reply to you several months later. At this point, you have already been accepted. They will invite you to the campus to have a visit with professors whose interest matches your own. After you arrive on campus, there will be a matching process to determine your adviser. In this process, you will discuss in depth the professor's research and you can meet all of their students. This typically takes 3-5 weeks. After the matching process is complete, you will be a member of the research team and will finally begin to undertake some research.
Interview Questions: When you visit the campus, you will have discussions with professors about research interest and  goals. Nothing too technical, they just want to see who you match with. It is quite a relaxed process, as by the time of the campus visit, you have already been accepted, and they are simply trying to convince you to choose CMU over other schools that may have also accepted you.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview

Depending on the professor, they can do technical and/or nontechnical interviews. My interview was nontechnical. So, be prepared for everything.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions:
I had an initial interview with the HR person that was pretty typical. Questions included the basic questions that a screener asked. Then I had an over the phone interview with the hiring manager. Then i had a third interview in person, where I had to have a presentation. 
The presentation was in front of a panel of people -- the team that I ultimately worked for. I also interviewed with team members from departments that I would be collaborating with. I got the sense that they only had me interview with them because my skill set closely aligned with them more than the team I would be working with.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in higher education?

title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was contact by email by the hiring supervisor.  I had a preliminary phone interview for about 30 minutes.  Within two hours, I received a call asking me to come to Pittsburgh for an in-person interview.  I was flown in, given a driver and a hotel, even picked up the next day for my interview (all totally covered).  I was given an agenda and had about 4 group meetings.  All very formal, but comfortable.  Most people gave a good vibe, but a few were obviously there because they had to be (one woman was texting most of the time).  After my meetings were done, the hiring manager who interviewed me said something along the lines of "I have a meeting to go to, but why don't you walk around the campus for a while by yourself until your car comes to get you."  At that point I almost lost it with her, wondering if I was being a burden to her and her time.  I was not even given a campus map to navigate.  However, I wanted the position so bad I quietly accepted her offer to explore the campus on my own.  I flew home, sent thank you emails.  Over the next two weeks they conducted a reference check and I was offered the position over the phone.  I negotiated a slightly higher salary and got a moving stipend as well.
Interview Questions: Nothing,  it was very unoriginal. While there were scripted questions, most of the people asking the technical and detailed questions did not even understand what they meant or why I should be able to answer them. They would ask a question, then explain what is it that they did.  The soft questions were the usual "about yourself or experiences"type questions.  Much of the focus was generically focused on how I would increase enrollment and program visibility.  My background was in distance delivery and program design, so that was the direction of my responses.  While they were hooked on the idea, NO-ONE knew enough to even ask follow-up questions.

title: Technical Coordinator, Administrative Computing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: The application was done online.  A month later I got an email about wanting to schedule an on campus interview at the Tepper School of Business.  Once it was schedule for the next day, the Director of HR said the interviews were running late by about 30 to 45 minutes.  It was a bit strange waiting in a common area with a handful of people clearly going to the same job.  There were 2 other coordinators and the HR director there.  They were very upfront with what they wanted and discussed a scenario about the first day of work, etc etc.  It was a fairly easy interview.  However it seemed if you did not know everything as an expert listed on their requirements, the interviewers were completely turned off by you.

title: Graduate Student, Master's In Computational Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online. There was an online screening process and an interview. For the interview you have the option to go to Pittsburgh in person or have the interview via skype.
In the interview they were looking for 3 things:
1-Make sure you look presentable. Dress professional and carry yourself in a professional manner.
2-Conversational skills. They want to know that if you go to a job interview after you graduate you will be able to get the job. So, you need to be able to have a conversation with the interviewer and get your points across.
3-Why You? You need to tell them why they should accept you and not someone else that satisfies 1 and 2. Figure out what distinguishes you from others.
Interview Questions: Why should we accept you?
